title: Wealth Tax
description: WA DOR wealth tax study findings, proposed structure, and revenue estimates

data.data_point: WA DOR Wealth Tax Study — proposed rate and threshold
data.value: 1% on financial intangible property above $250M per household
data.source_name: WA Dept of Revenue Wealth Tax Study Final Report
data.notes: Commissioned by WA Legislature; published November 2024

data.data_point: WA DOR Wealth Tax Study — estimated annual revenue
data.source_name: WA Dept of Revenue Wealth Tax Study Final Report
data.notes: Estimated ~700 affected households; targets < 0.01% of Washingtonians

data.data_point: WA DOR Wealth Tax Study — $100M threshold estimate
data.source_name: WA Cities / WA DOR Wealth Tax Study
data.notes: Governor's alternative proposal; broader reach than $250M threshold

data.data_point: WA residents with net worth over $50M
data.notes: Rapid growth in ultra-high-net-worth population in WA
More than 4x the state's $78B two-year operating budget; Bezos moved to FL in 2023
End of 2024; top 1% holds ~$55.8T, top 10% holds ~67% of total

data.data_point: WA estimated total household net worth
data.source_name: Derived from Fed Z.1 and BEA State GDP
data.notes: Proportional estimate using WA GDP share ($785B / $25.5T national GDP); actual may be higher due to tech wealth concentration
Applied to WA estimate: top 1% ~$1.73T, top 10% ~$3.52T, bottom 50% ~$315B
